definitions.definition: connected with the practical use of machines, methods, etc. in science and industry

examples.text: We offer free **technical support** for those buying our software.
The organization provides **technical assistance** to farmers.
technical drawing *(= especially taught as a school subject)*

definitions.definition: connected with the skills needed for a particular job, sport, art, etc.

examples.text: She doesn't possess the technical ability to perform the song well.
Skaters score extra points for technical complexity.

definitions.definition: connected with a particular subject and therefore difficult to understand if you do not know about that subject

examples.text: A lot of the discussions were **highly technical**.
The article is full of **technical terms**.
The guide is too technical for a non-specialist.
The conversation was getting a bit technical for me, so I left them to it.
Without getting too technical, this is basically how it works.

definitions.definition: connected with the details of a law or set of rules

examples.text: Their lawyers spent days arguing over technical details.
